bibl.title: Dressed for the Occasion. Clothes and Context in the Roman Army.
bibl.note: Contribution inédite [à paraître aussi dans: M.-L. NOSCH (Ed.), Proceedings of the International Conference on Military and Textile of the Center for Textile Research at Copenhagen (May 20-22, 2008)]. - The evidence clearly shows that Roman soldiers needed a substantial number and variety of clothes for summer and winter, different weather and various occasions. This explains why clothing paying plays such a prominent role in both private and official military documents and how this particular need of the Roman army led to the creation of the vestis militaris-tax.
